formatting_standards.overview: Formatting and content standards for release notes in docs/update-notes. Ensures consistent and clear release documentation.

convention.description: Major.minor version to summarize a release cycle.

element.name: frontmatter
element.description: All release notes must include frontmatter with a description, keywords, and a social share image. The title is generated automatically from the first H1 heading.
element.example: --- description: A concise summary of the release. keywords: - roo code x.y.z - new features - bug fixes image: /img/social-share.jpg ---

requirements.requirement: Include release date in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD.
Date must be the actual release date from GitHub tag OR current date if PR list provided.
CRITICAL: Month comes before day (MM-DD not DD-MM). Example: 2025-07-18 is July 18th.

date_format_critical.implementation_requirement: When PR list is provided directly (not fetched from GitHub), the mode MUST: 1. Execute the "determine_release_date" phase 2. Use new Date().toISOString().split('T')[0] to get current date 3. Validate that the month is 01-12 before using the date
date_format_critical.format_specification: ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DD where: - YYYY = 4-digit year (e.g., 2025) - MM = 2-digit MONTH (01-12) - NOT the day! - DD = 2-digit day (01-31)

element.name: summary_sentence
element.example: This release adds context condensing, improves performance, and fixes UI bugs.

expanded_sections.format:
## Feature Name
Description of what the feature does (thanks contributor!) ([#PR](link)):
- **Key Point 1**: Explanation of this aspect. - **Key Point 2**: Another explanation. - **Key Point 3**: More details.
Concluding sentence about the benefit.
> **ðŸ“š Documentation**: See [Feature Guide](/docs/path/to/feature) for detailed usage instructions.

documentation_links.rule: Include documentation link for all major features

grouped_sections.format:
## Section Name
* **Item Name**: Single-line description (thanks contributor!) ([#PR](link)) * **Another Item**: Another description ([#PR](link))

recommended_headings.heading: Major feature names (e.g., "## Context Condensing is Now Default")
## QOL Improvements
## Bug Fixes
## Misc Improvements
## Provider Updates
## Documentation Updates

section_headings.ordering_note: CRITICAL: QOL Improvements must always come before Bug Fixes

multiple_contributors.description: For multiple contributors (PR author + issue reporter).

rules.rule: Place inside parentheses before PR link.
Include both PR author and issue reporter.

placement.expanded: In intro paragraph or bullet points.
placement.grouped: At end of each bullet point.

rules.rule: Include release date in ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD).
CRITICAL: Verify date format - month before day.

combined_notes_updates.description: When creating patch releases, intelligently integrate changes into the parent minor/major file.

rules.rule: Add changes to their corresponding existing sections (Bug Fixes to Bug Fixes, etc.)
Do not include patch version numbers or PR links in combined notes
Maintain consistent formatting and section order
Append new items to the end of their respective sections
Update summary sentence if significant features were added

integration_approach.step: Read and parse existing combined notes structure
Map new changes to appropriate sections
Strip PR references from new items
Use apply_diff to insert items at the end of each section

guideline.name: Documentation links
guideline.description: Link to relevant docs for all major features.

forbidden_elements.element: Version numbers in docs outside update-notes.
Temporal references like "as of version X.Y.Z".
